caption: Startup Application
name: startup_app
description: The startup application object describes an application that has associated startup criteria and configurations.

name.description: The unique name of the startup application.

run_modes.description: The list of run_modes, normalized to the captions of the run_mode_id values.  In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the event source.

run_mode_ids.description: The list of normalized identifiers that describe the startup applications' properties when it is running.  Use this field to capture extended information about the process, which may depend on the type of startup application.  E.g., A Windows service that interacts with the desktop.

1.caption: Interactive
1.description: The application interacts with the desktop.

2.caption: Own Process
2.description: The application runs in its own process.

3.caption: Shared Process
3.description: The application runs in a shared process.

run_state.description: The run state of the startup application.

run_state_id.description: The run state ID of the startup application.

start_type.description: The start type of the startup application.

start_type_id.description: The start type ID of the startup application.

3.caption: Service
3.description: A background process typically managed by the operating system, e.g., a service process on Windows or a systemd-managed daemon on Linux.

4.caption: User Mode Application
4.description: An application that runs in the user space.

6.caption: System Extension
6.description: System extensions on macOS enables 3rd parties to extend the capabilities of macOS.

7.caption: Kernel Extension
7.description: Kernel extensions on macOS includes Apple provided pre-installs and 3rd party installs which enables support for specific hardware or software features not natively supported by macOS.

8.caption: Scheduled Job, Task
8.description: A job or task that runs on a configured schedule.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The startup application type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains data source specific values.

driver.description: The startup application kernel driver resource.
